clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of a Brief Lifestyle Intervention in Type 2 Diabetes, Compared With a Longer Group Educational Program
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of a Brief Group Program Versus a Longer Structured Program for Therapeutic Education of Patients With Type 2 Diabetes.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will compare two different programs for lifestyle intervention in type 2 diabetes:
1. A brief group program, with three weekly sessions
2. A longer group program, with six weekly sessions, which has been routinely used for the management of type 2 diabetic patients in this hospital for several years.
The aim is that of demonstrating the non-inferiority of the new brief, and more sustainable, program, in comparison with the more traditional approach.

primary_outcome.description: HbA1c within predefined target without any increase in pharmacological therapy

secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c within predefined target without any increase in pharmacological therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: MEditerranean DIet adherence LITErature-based (MEDI-LITE) questionnaire scores
secondary_outcome.description: 14-item questionnaire with scores ranging from 0 (low adherence) to 18 (high adherence)

secondary_outcome.measure: International Physical Activity Questionnaire-Short Form (IPAQ-SF) scores
secondary_outcome.description: 7-item questionnaire with scores ranging from 0 (no activity) to 7 (high activity)

secondary_outcome.measure: Well-being Enquiry in Diabetics (WED) questionnaire total score
secondary_outcome.description: 50-item questionnaire measuring diabetes-specific health-related quality of life, with scores ranging from 0 (low) to 50 (high). Only total score will be used in analysis 1. Mannucci E, et al., Diabetes Nutr Metab 9: 89-102, 1996).

arm_group.description: 3-session lifestyle group intervention program focussed on physical activity and eating habits, using interactive methods and a behavioral approach
6-session lifestyle group intervention program focussed on physical activity and eating habits, using traditional lessons and interactive methods

intervention.description: 3-session program for modification of lifestyle habits (exercise and diet)
6-session program for modification of lifestyle habits (exercise and diet)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes
- HbA1c between 48 and 75 mmol/mol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Axis I Mental Disorders
- Heart failure (NYHA Class III or IV)
- Foot ulcers or lower limb amputations
